newsitem.title: USA: Citrix says gets $75 mln in Microsoft deal.
newsitem.headline: Citrix says gets $75 mln in Microsoft deal.

text.p: Citrix Systems Inc said Monday it will receive an initial $75 million in fees and up to $100 million in royalties from its agreement with Microsoft Corp to license its multiuser server technology.
Citrix said its royalties depend on the shipment volumes of upcoming multi-user versions of the windows NT server network operating systems.

Citrix said it has also agreed with Microsoft to jointly market and promote the multi-user windows NT server-based software and Citrix's independent computing architecture thin-client/server software.
Citrix also said Microsoft has agreed to endorse for at least two years the Citrix software as the preferred way to provide multi-user windows access for devices other than windows clients.
Citrix said Microsoft will sell future versions of windows NT server that include multi-server capability, and Citrix will market its software that will run on the new platform.
